snippet: The Bulgarian man and his American husband were the first same-sex couple to get approval for a permanent resident visa after the Supreme Court struck down the Defense of Marriage Act.
abstract: Florida man Julian Marsh and his Bulgarian husband Traian Popov become first same-sex married couple to be approved for permanent resident visa, immigration milestone following Supreme Court decision striking down Defense of Marriage Act; approval is evidence of swift action by Obama administration to change its visa policies in wake of decision.
lead_paragraph: The Bulgarian man and his American husband were the first same-sex couple to get approval for a permanent resident visa after the Supreme Court struck down the Defense of Marriage Act.

headline.main: Gay Married Man in Florida Is Approved for Green Card
headline.print_headline: Green Card Is Approved For Gay Men In Florida

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
